meanings.definition: To set or thrust in motion
meanings.sent1: She enjoys launching her paper airplanes in the park.
meanings.sent2: The rocket launching into space was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent3: He kept launching his toy car down the slide, giggling each time.
meanings.sent4: The idea of launching a new business filled her with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The athlete launching himself over the hurdle displayed great skill.

meanings.sent1: Launching a new project can be both exciting and challenging.
meanings.sent2: The company is launching a new product line next month.
meanings.sent3: She was launching into a long story about her weekend adventures.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was launching into a lesson on ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent5: The band is launching their latest album with a concert tour.

meanings.sent1: The bakery is launching a new line of pastries this weekend.
meanings.sent2: The ship will be launching fireworks to celebrate the holiday.
meanings.sent3: He kept launching jokes during the meeting, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sun was launching its rays over the horizon, signaling a new day.
meanings.sent5: The garden was launching a burst of colors in the springtime.
